Job Description: IntroductionDo you know how to transform complex hightech information to small and understandable steps with clear illustrations Are you an expert at structuring texts and writing in accordance with standards Then you are the Technical Author we are looking forScope of the roleYou will create or edit all technical documentation Procedure, PCS, DDF, FCO, Newsflash, comments, etc for Equipment and Manufacturing Engineering and be the main interface for all authoring related issues, tooling and processesYou will be working in the department MSD DUV Industrialization, where you are responsible to create and maintain the technical communication needed to build and service our machines in the factory and field, based on the input of the manufacturing and equipment engineers Your support structurally improves the quality and usability of our proceduresMaster or bachelor degree, preferably in a technical areaThe goal of Manufacturing and Equipment Engineering is to industrialize ASML products while development is ongoing This means thinking about the manufacturing environment, the use and maintenance at the customer site, and to take into consideration lessons learned from the past If we focus on product industrialization early, we can prevent most of the manufacturing and quality problems in our factory as well as at the suppliers and even improve our delivery time The role of the Technical Author is to work as a team with DE, CS, Manufacturing, Sourcing to deliver on time and at the right level of qualityHigh quality people are a key asset to our company To recognize that, we offer highly competitive compensation and benefits packages to attract and retain the very best people and let them share in the success that they build Our rewards philosophy is to attract and retain specific professional knowledge and competencies within the company by offering a competitive package in local markets where ASML is activeThis position requires access to US controlled technology, as defined in the United States Export Administration Regulations Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to access such US controlled technology prior to beginning work Business demands may require ASML to proceed with applicants who are immediately eligible to access US controlled technology

Nearfield Instruments brings together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop a revolutionary high throughput atomic force microscopy AFM system, enabling atomscale resolution 3D metrology at industrylevel throughput We design, develop, integrate, market and service these advanced metrology machinesAs a Technical Writer you will be responsible for generating a large variety of technical documentation for NFI products users but also for NFI engineering teams This can be operations manuals, maintenance  service manuals, SW release updates, product catalogs to official governmental related acceptance documentation But also specific internal safety protocols to be followed by our engineering teams during integration and testing in our factory and work instructions used during installation and service at our customer sitesIt is required that the Technical Writer has good linguistic skills but also very much affinity with high tech products, preferably within the semiconductor industry As such, is familiar with the SEMI norms as well as the very strict safety regulations in the industry But also understand that user manuals, service manuals of this kind require very accurate description of the dos and dontsThe Technical Writer works with the MAIT engineers from the different subsystems, system integration and system function projects He or she collects, understands and translates the proper required technical information into the easier understanding of safe machine operationIt is really a must that the Technical Writer takes the responsibility to get the documentation written as complete and correct as possible by consulting the correct stakeholders and secure a proper review and acceptance of the written documentationThe technical author reports directly to the MAIT team lead and works within the project scope Furthermore, you need to recognize yourself in the profile as described belowBesides a technically challenging role where you can utilize the full extend of your professional knowledge, we value your worklive balance and the time for some relaxation Boost your energy by playing a match of table tennis or clear your mind during our weekly run with colleaguesWe rely on each others qualities, capabilities and we motivate one another to get the best out of ourselves and each other We are here to support one another, and colleagues are there to help you TEAM is very important, Together Everyone Achieves MoreWe look forward to hear from youIf the above mix of technical and personal challenges excites you, we encourage you to send us your details using the Apply now button If you have any questions before applying or would like to have a general conversation about Nearfield Instruments, you can contact our Recruiter, Harald van Klaveren on haraldvanklaverennearfieldinstrumentscom or 3106 1464 7117

onze afdeling Landelijke Projecten en onze 4 regios aan het winnende EMVIplan en aanverwante EMVIproducten Daarbij weet je vanuit de techniek de vertaalslag te maken naar een leesbaar onderscheidend technische informatie en weet de vertaalslag te maken naar begrijpbare tekstenJe analyseert de klantvraag, de EMVIcriteria en de beoordelaars, adviseert het tenderteam en maakt vervolgens op basis van Croonwolterdros zijn zeer divers Het varieert van een operatiekamer in een ziekenhuis tot high tech datacenters, laboratoria of onderwijsgebouwen Het betreft een binnendienstfunctie, maar het kan zijn werksfeer, bieden wij jou een aantrekkelijk salaris en uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden Maar Croonwolterdros beloont niet alleen in geld Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij alle mogelijkheid Vacature van Continu, locatie ApeldoornMet door jou opgestelde plannen de mooiste onderhouds en projecttenders binnenhalen Jij weet van welke service klanten gelukkig worden en zodra er projecten worden gewonnen wordt dit zeker gevierd met de collegas Is dit iets voor jou Lees dan snel verderAls EMVIschrijver ben jij dan ook degene die de klantwens weet te vertalen naar een oplossing Door interviews met de klantmanager, commercieel manager en zelfs de uitvoerder op locatie weet je precies wat de klant wil Maandelijks schrijf je gemiddeld twee plannen van aanpak voor verschillende opdrachtgevers in omgeving Apeldoorn Dit zijn vaak bijzondere locaties, zoals gevangenis of universiteitsgebouwen Dit gaat om tenders voor projecten of onderhoudscontracten tot circa 500000, Hierbij is het de bedoeling dat je deze trajecten op den duur zelfstandig zal leidenIn totaal zijn er zon 50 relaties in Apeldoorn en omstreken waar je events voor organiseert en klanttevredenheidsonderzoeken voert Dit doe je samen met de klantmanagers Daarnaast organiseer je het overleg met de betrokken teamleden, zorgt voor de kwaliteit van de documentatie en bewaakt de tenderplanning Een achtergrond in de journalistiek zou je dan ook niet misstaan, want het stellen van vragen en onderzoeken van de behoefte zal n van jou sterktes zijnOp de vestiging werken in totaal 160 medewerkers, waarvan circa 50 collegas bij jou op kantoor zitten Hierbij werk je voor de afdeling Bedrijfsbureau, waar het verwerven van aanbestedingen en selecties van voorbouwteams tot de dagelijkse gang van zaken behoren Voor een geintje is er altijd plek, maar iedereen is zo gemotiveerd dat iedereen zich volledig inzet voor het binnenhalen van de tender Je directe collegas zijn de twee commercieel managers en je leidinggevende Hiermee kun je prettig afstemmen en evalueren, zodat je snel stappen zal maken in je ontwikkeling5cd8a0b9cc68f9ffa4c9253553278a55

FunctieomschrijvingAls EMVIschrijver word jij onderdeel van ons tenderteam en ben je verantwoordelijk voor het kwalitatieve deel van de aanbesteding Samen met het tenderteam zorg je er op die manier voor dat onze winkansen gemaximaliseerd wordenTijdens een tender verzamel je in en extern de nodige informatie je neemt interviews af, inventariseert de inhoud van het project en denkt mee aan de aanpak Jouw omgevingskennis en commercile inslag combineer je met de financile kennis van de calculator en de technische kennis van de ontwerper om de winnende aanbieding op te stellen Belangrijke vraagstukken als hoe zijn wij de projectomgeving zo min mogelijk tot last en hoe zorgen wij dat we de planning behalen en de risicos beheersen behoren tot de orde van de dagVervolgens schrijf jij als EMVIschrijver ht aanbestedingsdocument waar onze klanten het meest enthousiast van worden Je werkt aan meerdere tenders tegelijk voor de duur van enkele weken tot enkele maanden en je bent betrokken vanaf het moment dat de aanvraag bij ons binnenkomt Je verwerkt alle verzamelde informatie van je collegas en vertaalt dit naar een overtuigend EMVIplan, waarmee je ons weet te onderscheiden van onze concurrentenIs presenteren jouw ding Dan krijg je van ons de mogelijkheid om het aanbestedingsplan aan de klant te presenteren en te verdedigen Overtuig jij de opdrachtgever van jouw aanbiedingNadat wij, mede door jouw werk, de aanbesteding hebben binnengehaald, blijf je ook nog betrokken bij de uitvoeringsfase Denk hierbij bijvoorbeeld aan het organiseren van een bewonersbijeenkomst Zo zie je ook hoe jouw plan in de praktijk tot zijn recht komtJe bent praktisch ingesteld en je hebt affiniteit met techniek Daarnaast beschik je over commercieel inzicht en een echte wil om te winnen Je bent creatief en komt met originele ideen en oplossingen voor problemen Je beschikt over uitstekende mondelingen en schriftelijke vaardigheden en je bent daarmee in staat om de vertaalslag te maken van technisch inhoudelijk naar begrijpelijk en aantrekkelijk Om een tender te winnen, moet je je goed in kunnen leven in de klant en begrijpen wat hij precies van je vraagt Daarom neem je geen genoegen met het eerste antwoord, maar vraag je door Daarnaast moet je ook beschikken over overtuigingskracht, want niet alleen externe partijen moet je overtuigen, maar ook intern moet je jouw collegas kunnen overtuigen van jouw keuzesWij bieden een verantwoordelijke, afwisselende en uitdagende functie bij een stabiel familiebedrijf Bovendien denken wij in mogelijkheden en daarom is er voor jou ruimte om te groeien en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen Daarnaast bieden wij je de kans om een bijdrage te leveren aan de duurzaamheid van onze projecten en is het maatschappelijk belang van ons werk groot Je werkt namelijk aan spraakmakende projecten die zich altijd afspelen op de grens van land en water zoals stevige dijken, kustbescherming en kadeconstructiesOp de grens van land en water zijn we helemaal thuis Onze kennis en ervaring vertalen we in duurzame oplossingen die we zorgvuldig afstemmen op de wensen van opdrachtgevers Wij leveren een belangrijke bijdrage aan de ontwikkeling, productie en realisatie van grond, bagger, constructie, funderings, kust en oeverwerken Constructief in waterbouw is dan ook ons motto Wij zijn een gerenommeerd familiebedrijf met circa 150 medewerkers Ons hoofdkantoor en eigen werkplaats met haven zijn gevestigd in Werkendam Dagelijks werken wij aan mooie projecten voor opdrachtgevers als Rijkswaterstaat, Provincies, particuliere havenexploitanten en petrochemische en watergerelateerde bedrijven

FunctieomschrijvingMet door jou opgestelde plannen de mooiste onderhouds en projecttenders binnenhalen Jij weet van welke service klanten gelukkig worden en zodra er projecten worden gewonnen wordt dit zeker gevierd met de collegas Is dit iets voor jou Lees dan snel verderAls EMVIschrijver ben jij dan ook degene die de klantwens weet te vertalen naar een oplossing Door interviews met de klantmanager, commercieel manager en zelfs de uitvoerder op locatie weet je precies wat de klant wil Maandelijks schrijf je gemiddeld twee plannen van aanpak voor verschillende opdrachtgevers in omgeving Apeldoorn Dit zijn vaak bijzondere locaties, zoals gevangenis of universiteitsgebouwen Dit gaat om tenders voor projecten of onderhoudscontracten tot circa 500000, Hierbij is het de bedoeling dat je deze trajecten op den duur zelfstandig zal leidenIn totaal zijn er zon 50 relaties in Apeldoorn en omstreken waar je events voor organiseert en klanttevredenheidsonderzoeken voert Dit doe je samen met de klantmanagers Daarnaast organiseer je het overleg met de betrokken teamleden, zorgt voor de kwaliteit van de documentatie en bewaakt de tenderplanning Een achtergrond in de journalistiek zou je dan ook niet misstaan, want het stellen van vragen en onderzoeken van de behoefte zal n van jou sterktes zijnOp de vestiging werken in totaal 160 medewerkers, waarvan circa 50 collegas bij jou op kantoor zitten Hierbij werk je voor de afdeling Bedrijfsbureau, waar het verwerven van aanbestedingen en selecties van voorbouwteams tot de dagelijkse gang van zaken behoren Voor een geintje is er altijd plek, maar iedereen is zo gemotiveerd dat iedereen zich volledig inzet voor het binnenhalen van de tender Je directe collegas zijn de twee commercieel managers en je leidinggevende Hiermee kun je prettig afstemmen en evalueren, zodat je snel stappen zal maken in je ontwikkelingHerken jij je in bovenstaande omschrijving van de functie Solliciteer dan direct via onderstaande knop

Functie inhoudIn de functie van EMVI Schrijver ben je op gericht op het binnenhalen van projecten Door het achterhalen van de klantvraag en het pakket van eisen weet je een sterk commercieel plan van aanpak te schrijven Hierbij speel je in op de behoeften van de klant en actuele themas Door jouw inzicht in de behoeften van de klant, gecombineerd met commercieel inzicht en sterke schriftelijke vaardigheden weet jij plannen te schrijven waarmee projecten gewonnen wordenFunctie de functie van EMVI Schrijver zoeken wij voor onze opdrachtgever naar een kandidaat met een afgeronde HBOWO opleiding richting Civiele Techniek, Bedrijfskunde, Communicatie of soortgelijk Je hebt een goed ontwikkelt analytisch en communicatief vermogen Je bent innovatief, resultaat gericht, creatief en weet mensen te overtuigen Je begrijpt de Civiele wereld en weet hoe projecten gewonnen en gerealiseerd wordenGeboden bieden je een full time dienstverband, een leuke functie en uitstekende ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden binnen een innoverende organisatie Uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden Deze functie is een mooi snijpunt tussen techniek, commercie en communicatie Wanneer dit bij jou past werk je vanuit jouw Kracht en zal je je in deze functie razendsnel kunnen ontwikkelen DerksIs dit de vacature die perfect aansluit bij jouw kracht Solliciteer dan direct via

Job Title: Junior EMVI Schrijver | Utrecht | Kracht Recruitment
Job Description: Vacature van Kracht Recruitment, locatie UtrechtAls Junior EMVI Economisch Meest Voordelige Inschrijving Schrijver ben jij iedere dag bezig met het winnende plan te schrijven om aanbestedingen te winnen voor jouw opdrachtgevers Je bundelt je krachten met collegas in het tenderteam en ben de spin in het web bij het behalen van de overwinning Met jouw creativiteit ben je in staat een winnend idee op tafel te kunnen leggen, waarmee de aanbesteding gewonnen kan worden Jij bent de schakel tussen de Tendermanager en de collegas die de technische input geven in het plan Dit werk je uit tot een winnend plan voor de deadline aflooptDit doe je namens onze opdrachtgever in de regio Utrecht Zij helpen je bij je ontwikkeling om steeds een stapje beter te worden en binnen notime d EMVI specialist te zijn binnen het team Je wordt ingezet bij diverse opdrachtgevers, waardoor je in relatief korte tijd met veel verschillende topprofessionals samenwerkt Je krijgt de kans om bij de meest succesvolle bedrijven in de bouw en infrabranche in de keuken te kijken Daarnaast zorgen je collegas er elke week voor dat je steeds meer kennis krijgt over het vakgebied, met daarbij ook je uiteindelijke doorgroeimogelijkheden Wie weet ben jij over 5  10 jaar wel d Projectmanager, Tendermanager, Omgevingsmanager of Contractmanager op toonaangevende miljoenen en miljardenprojecten Zij faciliteren, maar jij moet je status van talent waarmaken en de volgende sterspeler worden Het Champions League podium wordt je tenslotte al gebodenWe stellen geen enorme eisen aan deze rol Werkervaring is voor deze rol minder belangrijk dan potentie Belangrijk is dan ook met name de potentie die we in je zien in combinatie met ambitie, gedrevenheid en je contactuele vaardighedenZoals gezegd bieden we enorm veel doorgroeimogelijkheden en de juiste omstandigheden voor een optimale ontwikkeling Verder bieden we5cd8a0b9cc68f9ffa4c9253553278a55

Vacature van Continu, locatie WerkendamAls EMVIschrijver word jij onderdeel van ons tenderteam en ben je verantwoordelijk voor het kwalitatieve deel van de aanbesteding Samen met het tenderteam zorg je er op die manier voor dat onze winkansen gemaximaliseerd wordenTijdens een tender verzamel je in en extern de nodige informatie je neemt interviews af, inventariseert de inhoud van het project en technische systemen en installaties die de wereld om ons heen intelligenter maken Techniek die situaties herkent en hierop reageertWij zijn 2700 talenten met passie voor het vak Nieuwsgierig genoeg om zich voortdurend te vernieuwen en te verbeteren Wij zijn professionals Vakmensen die pas tevreden zijn als systemen en installaties precies doen waarvoor ze bedoeld zijn We gaan voor een sterk teamgevoel en het beste resultaat Samen zijn wij CroonwolterdrosOVER DE AFDELINGDe afdeling Landelijke Projecten binnen de divisie Utiliteit realiseert d grote landelijke projecten in Nederland Dit zijn projecten met een omvang tussen de  10000000, en  100000000, Dit betreffen grote nieuwbouw enof renovatieprojecten, waarbij we vrijwel altijd met de nieuwste technieken werkenNaast een plezierige werksfeer, bieden wij jou een aantrekkelijk salaris en uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden Maar Croonwolterdros beloont niet alleen in geld Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij alle mogelijkheid 300 cursussen enof opleidingen

Functie inhoudIn de functie van EMVI Schrijver ben je op gericht op het binnenhalen van projecten Door het achterhalen van de klantvraag en het pakket van eisen weet je een sterk commercieel plan van aanpak te schrijven Hierbij speel je in op de behoeften van de klant en actuele themas Door jouw inzicht in de behoeften van de klant, gecombineerd met commercieel inzicht en sterke schriftelijke vaardigheden weet jij plannen te schrijven waarmee projecten gewonnen wordenFunctie eisenVoor de functie van EMVI Schrijver zoeken wij voor onze opdrachtgever naar een kandidaat met een afgeronde HBOWO opleiding richting Civiele Techniek, Bedrijfskunde, Communicatie of soortgelijk Je hebt een goed ontwikkelt analytisch en communicatief vermogen Je bent innovatief, resultaat gericht, creatief en weet mensen te overtuigen Je begrijpt de Civiele wereld en weet hoe projecten gewonnen en gerealiseerd wordenGeboden wordtWij bieden je een full time dienstverband, een leuke functie en uitstekende ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden binnen een innoverende organisatie Uitstekende primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden Deze functie is een mooi snijpunt tussen techniek, commercie en communicatie Wanneer dit bij jou past werk je vanuit jouw Kracht en zal je je in deze functie razendsnel kunnen ontwikkelenOverigTom Derks06 15 94 88 65Is dit de vacature die perfect aansluit bij jouw kracht Solliciteer dan direct via

Als EMVI schrijver maak je onderdeel uit van het team wat betrokken is bij de aanbesteding In dit team ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vertalen van de input naar het plan om nog succesvoller te zijn in het scoren van projecten Tijdens jouw dagelijkse werkzaamheden taken ben jij bezig met het schrijven van kwaliteitsplannen voor relatief kleine projecten tot plannen voor multidisciplinaire complexe tenders bij diverse opdrachtgeverstechnische analyses en contractuele evaluaties van klantenvereistenzorg je ervoor dat je weet wat de klant van ons vraagt en organiseer je interne en externe sessies om hier invulling aan te gevenbetrek je interne en externe deskundigen bij het realiseren van de winnende EMVIdraag je er zorg voor dat de onderscheidende EMVI gedachte samengaat met de optimale kostprijsberekening en realistische technische uitvoeringswijzedraag je zorg voor review trajecten gedurende het gehele EMVI traject

Over de functie Wij zijn op zoek naar een plannenschrijver die onze tenderteams komt versterken Ben jij onze nieuwe collega, die staat te popelen om samen met een tenderteam de vraag van een klant te achterhalen en te doorgronden om deze vervolgens te vertalen naar een winnende offerte met een overtuigend EMVIplan Solliciteer dan nu Als EMVIschrijver ga je deel uit maken van verschillende tenderteams waarbij je de uitwerking van het kwalitatieve deel van de inschrijving cordineert en schrijft Wij zoeken een collega die weet hoe de vraag van de opdrachtgever moet worden geanalyseerd en doorgrondt, gevoel heeft bij de techniek en dit kan uitwerken tot een winnend plan Je natuurlijke nieuwsgierigheid naar de wensen en behoeften van klanten resulteert in het bedenken en samenbrengen van creatieve oplossingen Heb jij ervaring of affiniteit met techniek, dan willen we deze ervaring graag inzetten om onze opdrachtgevers op een hoog niveau te faciliteren, als het gaat om verschillende EMVIcriteria Te denken valt aan het leveren van kwaliteit, aandacht voor veiligheid en omgeving, slimme faseringen, innovaties en duurzaamheidWaar kom je te werken Werk je bij Mobilis, dan werk je bij een slimme verbinder Belangrijk, want alles in de bouw draait om verbinding Als civiele aannemer zijn wij gespecialiseerd in projecten in de betonbouw Als onderdeel van TBI heeft Mobilis het vermogen om het juiste team te koppelen aan de juiste technieken Wij snappen hoe partijen zo samenwerken dat ze telkens tot hun meerwaarde komen Of het nou om partners of onderaannemers gaat Of een project nou duurzaam, tegen minimale hinder of met een maatschappelijk doel gerealiseerd wordt Dankzij goede voorbereiding maken wij onze beloftes waar Samen staan we voor kwaliteit van bouwen, wat betekent dat je continu bekijkt welke innovaties je kunt toepassen Met een team van 370 Mobilianen bouwen we al ruim 100 jaar aan de infrastructuur van Nederland Dit doen wij vanuit de vestigingen in Apeldoorn, Nederweert en Rotterdam maar vooral vanuit de mooie projecten door heel Nederland Een greep uit onze uitdagende infra, water, industrie en energieprojecten de A13  A16 de Groeneboog, Oosterweelverbinding Antwerpen, Theemswegtrac, de RijnlandRoute en onderdoorgang Assen en RWZI in Weert ErvaringWat wij bieden Naast een plezierige werksfeer, bieden wij een goed salaris conform de functie en hebben wij een zeer aantrekkelijk pakket aan secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarde waaronder bijvoorbeeld 20 vakantiedagen, 10 roostervrije dagen en 13 individuele budgetdagen, TBIStudiefonds een bijdrage voor de studie van schoolgaande kinderen en een aantrekkelijke pensioenregeling Daarnaast biedt Mobilis je alle mogelijkheden om binnen de organisatie te werken aan jouw persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling door middel van opleidingen Doorgroeimogelijkheden zijn er volop bij Mobilis, afhankelijk van jouw ambitie en inzet Interesse Ben jij na het lezen van deze vacature net zo enthousiast geworden, als dat wij zijn en wil je samen met ons aan verder aan jouw toekomst bouwen Solliciteer dan via de button Voor vragen kan je contact op nemen met onze HRadviseur Franka Braakman via fbraakmantbinl of 0683662638 We zien wij je sollicitatie graag tegemoet Acquisitie wordt niet op prijs gesteld Aan het zonder opdracht voorstellen van kandidaten kunnen geen rechten cq verplichtingen worden ontleend

Profiel opdrachtgever Bij deze opdrachtgever gaat het steevast over slimmer verbinden en beter verbouwen Met een team van meer dan 400 medewerkers bouwen ze al ruim 100 jaar de infrastructuur van Nederland Projecten zijn gelokaliseerd over heel Nederland Door de omvang van het bedrijf is er de mogelijkheid om het juiste team te koppelen aan de juiste technieken Deze opdrachtgevers begrijpt dat op die manier samenwerken meerwaarde ontstaat Naast verbinding staan ze voor kwaliteit van bouwen Wat inhoudt dat ze continue kijken welke innovaties er toegepast kunnen worden Functie inhoud Ben jij d plannenschrijver die deze opdrachtgever zoek De tenderteams kunnen namelijk wel wat extra versterking gebruiken Jij bent als Medior EMVISchrijver diegene die de vraag van de klant kan achterhalen, en deze samen met jouw team te doorgronden om deze vervolgens te vertalen naar een winnende offerte door middel van een EMVIplan In jouw rol maak je deel uit van verschillende tenderteams, en cordineer en schrijf je de uitwerking van het kwalitatieve deel van de inschrijving Het is daarbij noodzakelijk dat je klantvraag goed kan doorgronden en analyseren Ook gevoel van techniek helpt bij het komen tot een winnend plan Jouw nieuwsgierigheid en creativiteit helpt je verder op weg jij bent in staat om creatieve oplossingen te bedenken En mocht je ervaring hebben met techniek of veel affiniteit hiermee, dan kan deze ervaring goed ingezet worden om de klanten op een hoog niveau te faciliteren, als het gaat om verschillende EMVIcriteria Enkele aspecten hiervan zijn kwaliteit, aandacht voor veiligheid en omgeving, slimme faseringen, innovaties en duurzaamheid Zie jij jezelf al plannen schrijven als EMVISchrijver Infra bij deze opdrachtgever Functie eisen Jij herkent jezelf in de volgende punten

Be a hero Jij bent de Junior EMVI Schrijver die als het frisse talent de organisatie binnenkomt Samen met het team Verwerving ga je schrijven aan de winnende aanbieding en nadenken over welke wijze de projecten hebt beste ontworpen worden En daarna hoe worden ze uitgevoerd en opgeleverd Jij schrijft hiervoor het plan, waarin je de vrijheid krijgt om je creativiteit te gebruiken en je draagt nieuwe ideen aan Je analyseert als EMVI Schrijver de behoefte van de klant en kijkt naar innovatieve oplossingen om bent onderscheidend binnen het tender proces Hiermee houd je niet alleen rekening met de goedkoopste en meest effectieve uitvoeringsmethodieken, maar ben je ook bewust van de behoefte van de klant Al met al als EMVI Schrijver krijg je meteen al veel mogelijkheden om jezelf te laten zien binnen de organisatie en daarbuiten Benefits

The Institute of Public Administration of Leiden University is seeking aPostdoctoral researcherIn the context of a NORFACEfunded project Reconnecting Citizens to the Administrative State ReConnectThe project is being conducted in collaboration with London School of Economics and Political Science, Kings College London, BI School of Management Norway, and IBEI Spain The successful candidate will work together with prof dr Caelesta Braun and dr Bert Fraussen as part of the Leiden University project moduleThe successful candidate will support this major comparative research project that explores the nature of changing demands on contemporary administrative states, and the responses by administrative states to these demands The overall project focuses on areas of constitutional, regulatory, welfare, and civil society engagement visavis administrative states in comparative perspective The Leiden Universitybased module is to lead on the civil society engagement element of the project, but also to support the research efforts of the other project teams The project involves a range of research strategies, and the successful candidate will be centrally involved in the conduct of the fieldwork for this projectThe Faculty of Governance and Global Affairs offers academic education in the field of Public Administration, Safety and Security, and International Relations, as well as indepth postacademic programmes for professionals In addition, the Faculty is also home to the Leiden University College For more information, see the website of the Faculty of Governance and Global AffairsThe postdoctoral researcher to be recruited will be part of an ambitious and dynamic team of colleagues who intend to build further on the successes of recent years, in an environment of cooperation across disciplinary borders You will be appointed for 12months Depending upon funding and performance, the position can be extended for the duration of the project maximum 24 months in total We would prefer you to start as soon as possibleSalary range is from  2790 to 4402 gross per month pay scale 10, in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch UniversitiesLeiden University offers an attractive benefits package with additional holiday 8 and endofyear bonuses 83 , training and career development and sabbatical leave Our individual choices model gives you some freedom to assemble your own set of terms and conditions Candidates from outside the Netherlands may be eligible for a substantial tax break For more information, see the websiteLeiden University is strongly committed to diversity within its community and especially welcomes applications from members of underrepresented groupsFor further inquiries about the vacancy, please contact Caelesta Braun, email chjmbraunfggaleidenunivnlPlease submit online your application via the in our application system

The project is being conducted in collaboration with London School of Economics and Political Science, Kings College London, BI School of Management Norway, and IBEI Spain The successful candidate will work together with prof dr Caelesta Braun and dr Bert Fraussen as part of the Leiden University project moduleThe successful candidate will support this major comparative research project that explores the nature of changing demands on contemporary administrative states, and the responses by administrative states to these demands The overall project focuses on areas of constitutional, regulatory, welfare, and civil society engagement visavis administrative states in comparative perspective The Leiden Universitybased module is to lead on the civil society engagement element of the project, but also to support the research efforts of the other project teams The project involves a range of research strategies, and the successful candidate will be centrally involved in the conduct of the fieldwork for this project

Job Title: Assistant professor Developmental, Stem Cell and Cancer Biology
Job Description: Are you fascinated by basic biomedical research at the intersection of developmental, stem cell and cancer biology Are you equally passionate about research and teaching in this area Then this is a unique opportunity We are looking for an assistant professor universitair docent who will strengthen our teamYou will be embedded in the Developmental, Stem Cell and Cancer Biology group led by dr Rene van Amerongen, which is part of the Cell  Systems Biology cluster of the Swammerdam Institute for Life Sciences in the Faculty of Science at the University of AmsterdamResearch in our group aims to understand how complex tissues are built and maintained We study this at multiple different levels  from man or mouse to molecule  using a variety of experimental approaches and with a specific focus on WNT signal transduction, mammary gland biology and breast cancer See our website for more detailsWe aim to recruit someone who is willing to devote 50 of their time to teaching Some of these activities will be connected to the research theme of the group, but you are also expected to contribute to teaching on a broader range of subjects in the Biology and Biomedical Sciences programs BSc and MSc level In time, you should also be able to take on smaller or larger management roles in educationThe other 50 of your time will be dedicated to research We look forward to welcoming a new colleague with original ideas and a healthy research ambition that aligns with the overall research theme of our group Applicants with a background in andor an affinity for breast cancer, organoids, gene regulation, omics techniques andor bioinformatics would especially complement our current skill setYou are expected toWhat do we requireOur ideal candidate also hasIf you are interested but have any hesitation as to whether you would be a fit for this position, please contact dr Rene van AmerongenIn this position, you will be able to apply for grants and act as daily supervisor for PhD students Our goal is to recruit someone who will strengthen our team by contributing their skills and expertise to our existing research program in order to achieve common resultsPlease note that this position does not necessarily require an extensive prior teaching record, although this will be beneficial Ideally, you have at least some teaching experience including student supervision to demonstrate your competence in this area Still, enthusiasm for and affinity with teaching and education are more important than experience at this pointWithin the Faculty of Science, newly appointed assistant professors follow a didactic training trajectory, which upon completion results in a qualification for academic teaching basiskwalificatie onderwijs, BKO within two yearsSILS expects its staff to acquire sufficient fluency in the Dutch language within three years of the start of the employment contractOur offerInitially a temporary contract for 38 hours a week, preferably starting on 1 January 2021 for the duration of 2 years A permanent contract follows if we assess your performance positiveThe salary, depending on relevant work experience before the beginning of the employment contract, will be 3,746 to 5,127 scale 11 gross per month, based on a fulltime contract of 38 hours a week This is exclusive 8  holiday allowance and 8,3 endofyear bonus A favourable tax agreement, the 30 ruling, may apply to nonDutch applicants The Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities is applicableAre you curious about our extensive package of secondary employment benefits like our excellent opportunities for study and development Then find out more about working at the Faculty of ScienceThe Faculty of Science has a student body of around 7,000, as well as 1,600 members of staff working in education, research or support services Researchers and students at the Faculty of Science are fascinated by every aspect of how the world works, be it elementary particles, the birth of the universe or the functioning of the brainThe Swammerdam Institute for Life Sciences SILS is one of the Faculty of Sciences largest institutes Its approximately 240 scientists and staff members work in 16 research groups that perform excellent research centered around four themes 1 Microbiology, 3 Neurosciences, 4 Green Life SciencesDo you have questions about this vacancy Or do you want to know more about our organisation Please contactJob applicationDo you recognize yourself in the job profile Then we look forward to receiving your application by 7 December 2020 You may apply online by using the link belowApplications in pdf should includePlease mention the months not just years in your CV when referring to your education and work experience

work together with prof dr Caelesta Braun and dr Bert Fraussen as part of the Leiden University project moduleThe successful candidate will support this major comparative research project that Job Title: postdoc on Standard Model Effective Field Theory interpretation of Higgs experimental data (ATLAS/Theory)
Company Name: Nikhef Nationaal instituut voor subatomaire fysica
Job Description: Nikhef, the national institute for subatomic physics in The Netherlands, is looking for apostdoc on Standard Model Effective Field Theory interpretation of Higgs experimental data ATLASTheoryNikhef is the national institute for subatomic physics in The Netherlands At Nikhef, approximately 175 physicists and 75 technical staff members work together in an open and international scientific environment Together, they perform theoretical and experimental research in the fields of particle and astroparticle physics The Nikhef institute is a collaboration between six major Dutch universities and the Dutch Foundation for Scientific Research NWONikhef participates in large research collaborations, including the ATLAS, LHCb and ALICE experiments at CERN, the KM3NeT neutrino telescope in the Mediterranean, the VIRGO interferometer in Pisa, the Xenon1T dark matter experiment in Gran Sasso, the Pierre Auger cosmic ray observatory in Argentina and the eEDM research programme in Groningen Nikhef also hosts a group in theoretical physics, and groups for Physics Data Processing and detector RD, all with good connections to the experimental programsThe Nikhef ATLAS group consists of groups in Amsterdam and Nijmegen, for a total of 15 staff, and typically 5 postdocs and 20 PhD students As a founding member of the ATLAS collaboration, the group has a longterm involvement in both detector construction the semiconductor tracker, barrel muon chambers, readout, alignment, and data acquisition as well as operations trigger and muon tracking reconstruction For the phase2 upgrade 20252027, we will assemble and commission one of the endcaps of a new allsilicon inner tracking system ITk in Amsterdam and develop a new universal readout system FELIX for all ATLAS detector systems The group also has a strong record in physics data analysis, with strong focus on Higgs boson physics, top quark physics and machinelearning assisted searches for new physics signatures Nikhef also hosts an ATLAS Tier1 data processing center, and offers substantial additional computing resources for enduser data analysis and simulationThe Nikhef Theory is composed by 10 staff members and around 10 postdocs and 15 PhD students The group has a strong expertise in effective field theories, higher order calculations in quantum chromodynamics, machine learning in particle physics, proton structure determinations, flavor and beyond the standard model physics, and cosmology among others The group also has strong connections with other national and international groups in theoretical high energy physics, as well as frequent interactions with the experimental groups at NikhefThe Nikhef Atlas and Theory groups have a large and active research program on Higgs data analysis, with a recent focus on interpretation of joint datasets in the framework of SM Effective Field Theory The successful candidate will work on effective field theory interpretations of Higgs production measurements at the LHC, both within the ATLAS collaboration and for standalone theoretical and feasibility studies Potential candidates should have a strong interest in collider phenomenology and effective theories The candidate is expected to qualify as author of the ATLAS collaboration, which entails a contribution to the operation of the ATLAS experiment note that being already qualified is not a requirement for the position For candidates with a theoretical background, expertise with modelling tools relevant for EFT interpretations, eg in the domain of MC event generation, is encouragedThis position offered is part of a joint ATLASTheory program that also comprises a PhD position on SMEFT development in the theory group, and comes with substantial dedicated computing resources for data analysis and simulation studies The scientific program of this position also aligns strongly with that of the NWOfunded physics program At the heart of the Higgs , which will comprise an additional 7 PhD positions and 3 postdoc positions in the Nikhef ATLAS group in the period 20212026 all focused on Higgs boson physics This program offers networking opportunities and specialized training programs in data analysis techniques and Higgs boson physics that are also available to the candidateExcellent software and programming skills, in particular in C and Python, are specially encouraged The ideal candidate has prior expertise in SM Effective Field theory andor ATLAS Higgs data analysis Applicants should have a PhD degree in theoretical or experimental particle physics or a closely related topic by the time they start their appointment at Nikhef or shortly thereafterThe candidate will be employed by the NWOI foundation for a period of three years and will obtain the status of postdoctoral researcher During this time, there is the possibility of a secondment at CERN for a period of 1 year Shehe will receive a competitive salary The conditions of employment are excellent and include extra months salary payment in May and December The conditions of employment of the NWOIfoundation can be found atQualified applicants are encouraged to apply by clicking the apply now button below Please be prepared to upload a curriculum vitae and have the email address of at least three referees ready, who are willing to send a letter of recommendation on your behalf The deadline for applications is December 10th, 2020 Further information on this position can be obtained from dr Juan Rojo click apply or prof dr Wouter Verkerke click applyPostdoc

Job Title: Sr. Support Engineer - Terraform Enterprise - Netherlands
Job Description: About HashiCorpHashiCorp is a fastgrowing startup that solves development, operations, and security challenges in infrastructure so organizations can focus on missioncritical tasks We build tools to ease these decisions by presenting solutions that span the gaps Our tools manage both physical machines and virtual machines, Windows, and Linux, SaaS and IaaS, etcHashiCorp is looking for a highcaliber customer facing engineering professional to join its Support Engineering team This is an exciting opportunity to join a small team and have a direct impact on HashiCorps fast growing business This highly visible position will be an integral part of both the support engineering and Terraform Open SourceEnterprise teams You are a fit if you thrive in a fastpaced culture that values essential communication, collaboration, and results This person is a selfmotivated, detailed individual with an eye for automation, process improvement, and problem solvingWorking with the Manager, Support Engineering, this Senior Support Engineer will be a key member of the Customer Success organization and will directly impact customer satisfaction and success This individual will solve sophisticated issues related to Terraform and Terraform Enterprise and independently work to find viable solutions They will contribute to product growth and development via weekly product and marketing meetings You will attend customer meetings as needed to help identify, debug and resolve the customer issue and is expected to be a liaison between the customer and HashiCorp engineering When possible, our Support Engineers will update and improve documentation, guide feature development, and implement bug fixes based on customer feedbackHashiCorp embraces diversity and equal opportunity We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be

Job DescriptionJanssen Vaccines  Prevention BV is part of Johnson  Johnson, one of the biggest and most respected health care companies in the world We are dedicated to bringing meaningful innovation to global health Our teams focus on the discovery, development, manufacturing and marketing of novel vaccines to prevent some of the most devastating and complex infectious diseases These range from respiratory infections like respiratory syncytial virus RSV to human immunodeficiency virus HIV and pathogens of global concern such as Ebola and COVID19In our organization, entrepreneurial people are working in a dynamic culture in which innovation and a can do state of mind are of crucial importance We are continuously looking for enthusiastic, talented people who have the ambition to develop themselves and can be of value to Janssen The offices of Janssen Vaccines  Prevention are located in Leiden, The NetherlandsDepartmentThe USP department is responsible for early as well as latestage development of scalable, pharmaceuticalgrade production processes for viral vaccines using mammalian cell lines as a production platform Novel technologies are used to make sure that the processes are safe, reliable, scalable and costeffective, so that the vaccines can be produced in large quantities at low costs The developed production processes are transferred into GMP production facilities for the production of clinical batches and scaledup for commercial production This is done in close collaboration with many partners in Discovery, Development and Supply Chain in an international environment Within the USP department, a lab team is responsible for performing all handson experimental activities, data processing and documentation, whereas a team of scientists is responsible for the overall scientific approach and progress within our projects The current focus of the USP department is on developing a robust process for the manufacturing of the COVID19 vaccine and transferring the technology to multiple production facilities In order to support these activities we are looking for an experienced senior scientist

Wat ga je doenWhat will your job be Are you a motivated postdoc and are you expertised with techniques as ELISA, qPCR, cell culturebased assays and NGS As a Scientist Molecular Bioassays, you you will act as a technical lead to strengthen the product development strategy Interested Apply now In this role as a Scientist Molecular Bioassays, you will develop bioassays for characterization of vaccines You will act as a technical lead to strengthen the product development strategy of the MBA team To do so, you will actively share expertise in technologies such as ELISA, qPCR, cell culturebased assays andor NGS Assay development activities will mainly focus on assays that measure quantity potency, purity and identity characteristics of our products You aim to shape the life cycle management up to and including validation of methods for release and characterization of our vaccine Furthermore you take ownership as author in the preparation of presentations, documents for regulatory filing and patents Wat vragen wij

Job Title: Postdoctoral researcher in Computational Social Science
Job Description: Are you a passionate and committed researcher and well versed in cuttingedge computational social science approaches Would you like to be involved in frontier research on largescale network analysis and official register data and work with highly qualified researchers in an interdisciplinary academic environment Effective immediately, we are seeking a postdoc in Computational Social Science You will be part of the POPNET platform, and your position is hosted by the Faculty of Humanities You will do your research under the aegis of the Institute for Logic, Language and Computation ILLC The ILLC is a renowned research institute at the University of Amsterdam, in which researchers from the Faculty of Humanities and the Faculty of Science collaborateAs an ideal candidate for this position, you find yourself at home in the international computational social science research community You have a welldeveloped skillset in scientific programming and an affinity with network analysis in particular You are able to work with very large data and have the creativity and curiosity to develop new network measures and statistics You are keenly aware of the ethical issues related to using large scale social register data and want to contribute to a responsible scholarly practice on big data analyticsYou may have a disciplinary background in either social sciences, humanities or computational sciences, but you strongly believe in interdisciplinary collaboration You are a creative team player who does not shy back from entering new scholarly terrain You have creativity, precision, and perseverance You do not believe universities should be ivory towers but rather sites for independent thought and academic progress, working together with stakeholders inside and outside academia You take initiative, have excellent communication skills, and you are well able to work in a team as well as independently You like to collaborate both with academics and nonexperts and you can present complex statistical models to both groups in a bespoke manner You care more about social impact of your work than impact factors, but because you are ambitious you always aim for the topDo you recognize yourself Do you want to be involved in frontier computational social science research Are you thrilled by the opportunity to work in a truly interdisciplinary research environment Send us your applicationPOPNETSSH is a novel digital infrastructure and research community with the aim of unlocking longitudinal social network data on the entire population of the Netherlands for academic research purposes A firstofakind research infrastructure tailored in terms of hard and software specifically for largescale social network analysis will be developed The available data includes the complete social network at populationscale of the 17 million inhabitants of Netherlands, including all family, neighborhood, school and work relations, as well as demographic information From this, actionable insights into key issues including segregation, substantive social change, and UN sustainable development goals such as reducing inequality can be obtainedThe project is a collaboration of the University of Amsterdam UvA, Leiden University UL and Statistics Netherlands CBS The researcher will work in an interdisciplinary social data science environment, bringing together computer science with the social sciences and humanitiesWe will put together a curriculum which will also include the opportunity to attend training courses and both national and international eventsYou may also be tasked with smaller teaching activitiesFurther informationDo you have any questions or do you require additional information Please contactWould you like to learn more about working at the University of Amsterdam Visit our websiteOur offerThe selected Postdoctoral researcher will be employed at the University of Amsterdams Faculty of Humanities within the Department of Media Studies and will execute the research in the ILLC The employment contract will be for 38 hours per week 1,0 FTE for a maximum of two years The initial employment is for 1 year Following a positive assessment and barring altered circumstances, this term will be extended by 1 year The intended starting date is 1 February 2021 or as soon as possible thereafter The gross monthly salary may range from 3,491 scale 105 to 4,012 scale 112 depending on experience and qualifications, in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities We additionally offer an extensive package of secondary benefits, including 8 holiday allowance and a yearend bonus of 8,3To work at the University of Amsterdam is to work in a discerning, independent, creative, innovative and international climate characterised by an open atmosphere and a genuine engagement with the city of Amsterdam and societyJob applicationDoes this profile sound like you If so, we are eager to receiveThe deadline for applications is 3 December 2020 Interviews will take place between 7 and 11 December 2020 The intended starting date is 1 February 1 2021 or as soon as possible thereafter

Company Name: HiiL The Hague Institute for Innovation of Law
Job Description: Final Project EvaluationTerms of ReferenceAuthorDocument Number1MTBORevisionReview byV120102020MTBOTS, MB, RL, VYSMThese are the Terms of Reference for the final project evaluation of the Uganda Justice Innovation Programme with grantID 51180135HiiL has been active in Uganda since 2015 In addition to our headquarters in The Hague with 39 international staff, we have a local office in Kampala with three local staff members in October 2020In partnership with the Swedish Embassy in Uganda, HiiL has been running the Uganda Justice Innovation Programme since 2017 and activities will end on 31 December 2020 The programme was designed to ensure that more people in Uganda, in particular the most vulnerable, are empowered to resolve their most pressing justice problems more fairly and effectively Together with our partners, we work to increase capacity of the justice system and make it more open, inclusive and innovative The programme followed on from a Justice Needs and Satisfaction survey that was conducted in 2015 and aimed to address some of those justice needsProgramme RationaleAt the time of development the rationale behind the programme is summarised below Lessons have been learnt along the way and some of that rationale will have changed and will need to be incorporated into the evaluationBetter justice delivery is organised through collecting and sharing data from the experiences of the users of the justice system This data creates more awareness of the most pressing justice needs, the quality and costs of access to justice amongst the users of justice, civil society organisations, publicly funded justice delivery organisations, academia, the different arms of government, and donors, on the basis of which they can advocate, prioritize, and work to improve services and procedures through evidencebased learning Additionally by capturing best practices on what works on family justice issues, this can be used by practitioners to improve on the delivery of justiceEach country has social entrepreneurs Entrepreneurship is an enabler, a driver and an empowering tool for sustainable development The power of entrepreneurship can also be harnessed to increase access to justice The most promising justice entrepreneurs are selected to address problems identified in the justice needs survey and accelerated to increase their impact, based on sustainable funding models and using business acceleration methods This will increase access to justice that is locally owned, embedded, and sustainably fundedFinally traditional rule of law building activities, such as building capacity and infrastructure, do not suffice Innovative approaches that start from citizens needs and take the political dimension of rule of law building into account are essential This requires supporting agents of sustainable change at all levels, including justice reformers at the highest political level who experience strong resistance and challenges in improving the justice system Through providing peer support and advice to justice leaders at the highest political level, they develop stronger leadership knowledge, skills, attitudes, personalities and networks, which positions them to innovate, develop and maintain effective justice systemsThe majority of the programme has taken place in Kampala, though a part of the work has taken place in other areas Arua, Mbarara, Soroti, Kibaale district as well The original logframe is attachedProgramme ObjectivesThe main objectives of the programme can be summarised as followsThe expected outcomes per component of the project can be found in the logframe document attached with this ToREvaluation purpose and intended useThe primary aim is to assist HiiL management, stakeholders, and the donor Sida to understand the overall project performance towards achieving its objectives, and to provide learning points from experiences of the project Specifically, the evaluation aims toThe primary users will be the Management Team of HiiL, the Product Group Directors and local office staff in Kampala to make adjustments and improvements to the design and implementation of future programmesHiiL will also use the evaluation to understand how the programme activities fit within the local context of Uganda and align with the national action plans of the Ugandan justice sectorThe evaluation will be shared with SIDA, the Swedish Embassy in Kampala, to contribute to knowledge building in justice innovation programmes The evaluation may also be shared with the Justice Law and Order Sector Secretariat and Leadership Committee and the Dutch Embassy in KampalaThe evaluation is based on the project logframe and proposal The evaluation covers the period of 20172020 and focuses on the processes, results at various levels, as well as connections and relations between results It will concern activities conducted during the SIDA programme in Uganda onlyThe evaluation shall conform to OECD DAC criteria for evaluations and focus on the following criteriaRelevanceCoherenceEffectivenessEfficiencySustainabilityImpactLessons and best practices learned from the projectMethodologyThe proposed evaluation shall build on existing theories and reports conducted previously Due to the Covid 19 pandemic, travel to the region will not be possible The evaluation will therefore be done by an international consultant at distance, who is expected to gather data virtually andor liaise with a local data collection company in Uganda for primary data collection The evaluation is expected to use a gender sensitive approachmethodology, methods, tools and data analysis techniquesThe design of the evaluation should include the following elements but HiiL remains open to suggestionsDeliverablesTimelineStart date 1 December 2020Inception report 15 December 2020Evaluation start 1 January 2021Draft report 1 March 2021Final report 31 March 2021Logistical supportA Steering Committee composed of Project Management and MEL Specialist will coordinate the process of the evaluationHiiL will provide the following support to the evaluation teamThe focal point of contact is the MEL Specialist at HiiL, who is supported by the Steering Committee The local office in Uganda will provide additional support if requiredHiiL is looking for a consultant, or team of consultants, with the following experience and capacityThe criteria for awarding contracts resulting from this Request for Proposals are based on best value for moneyA complete assessment of technical, organisational and pricing factors quality of the training, content, trainers, previous experience, the format in which it is presented, ability to execute the training online if needed and the delivery timeTechnical evaluation total points 100 counts for 60 To be technically acceptable, a proposal must meet or exceed the requirements and specifications in the Request for Proposals as listed belowTechnical criteriaDocuments requiredMax scoreProposal addressing all technical requirements in experience and capacity, demonstrating an understanding of the ToR, methodology, tools to be used, and formatProposal which outlines the work plan, methodology, team and risk mitigation due to Covid 19 situation60Proof of expertise and knowledge needed to carry out the evaluationCV and 2 references from organisations that can verify the quality of the consultants work and or publicly available example of a previous evaluation40Only proposals that score a minimum of 50 points for the technical evaluation will go to the commercial evaluationCommercial evaluation total points100 counts for 40Commercial criteriaDocuments requiredMax scoreProposal clearly indicating the pricesFinancial offer outlining the budget in EUR100Proposals may be submitted on or before 22 November 2020 at 1700 CEST only through email to the following email address michelletonhiilorg  Proposals shall be submitted in English, signed by the organisation, and with the subject line Evaluation Ugandaname organisationAn online interview will be part of the assessment process and take place in the final week of November 1st week of DecemberPlease email michelletonhiilorg to receive the original programme logframe In 2020 additional outputs and activities were added but the outcomes remain the same

The project is being conducted in collaboration with London School of Economics and Political Science, Kings College London, BI School of Management Norway, and IBEI Spain The successful candidate will work together with prof dr Caelesta Braun and dr Bert Fraussen as part of the Leiden University project moduleThe successful candidate will support this major comparative research project that explores the nature of changing demands on contemporary administrative states, and the responses by administrative states to these demands The overall project focuses on areas of constitutional, regulatory, welfare, and civil society engagement visavis administrative states in comparative perspective The Leiden Universitybased module is to lead on the civil society engagement element of the project, but also to support the research efforts of the other project teams The project involves a range of research strategies, and the successful candidate will be centrally involved in the conduct of the fieldwork for this projectOffer Requirements

Job Title: Program Director, LASER PULSE USAID Funded Program - Rotterdam
Job Description: LASER Long Term Services for Research PULSE Partners for Universityled Solutions Engine is a fiveyear, 70M USAID funded program to deliver researchdriven solutions to fieldsourced development challenges in USAID interest countries and technical sectors Funded through USAIDs Global Development Lab, LASER PULSE is implemented by a Purdue Universityled consortium with Catholic Relief Services, Indiana University, Makerere University, and the University of Notre Dame LASER PULSE convenes a growing network of 2,300 researchers and development practitioners in 54 countries It Are you a passionate and committed researcher and well versed in cuttingedge computational social science approaches Would you like to be involved in frontier research on largescale network analysis and official register data and work with highly qualified researchers in an interdisciplinary academic environment Effective immediately, we are seeking a postdoc in Computational Social Science You will be part of the POPNET platform, and your position is hosted by the Faculty of Humanities You will do your research under the aegis of the Institute for Logic, Language and Computation ILLC The ILLC is a renowned research institute at the University of Amsterdam, in which researchers from the Faculty of Humanities and the Faculty of Science collaborateAs an ideal candidate for this position, you find yourself at home in the international computational social science research community You have a welldeveloped skillset in scientific programming and an affinity with network analysis in particular You are able to work with very large data and have the creativity and curiosity to develop new network measures and statistics You are keenly aware of the ethical issues related to using large scale social register data and want to contribute to a responsible scholarly practice on big data analyticsYou may have a disciplinary background in either social sciences, humanities or computational sciences, but you strongly believe in interdisciplinary collaboration You are a creative team player who does not shy back from entering new scholarly terrain You have creativity, precision, and perseverance You do not believe universities should be ivory towers but rather sites for independent thought and academic progress, working together with stakeholders inside and outside academia You take initiative, have excellent communication skills, and you are well able to work in a team as well as independently You like to collaborate both with academics and nonexperts and you can present complex statistical models to both groups in a bespoke manner You care more about social impact of your work than impact factors, but because you are ambitious you always aim for the topDo you recognize yourself Do you want to be involved in frontier computational social science research Are you thrilled by the opportunity to work in a truly interdisciplinary research environment Send us your applicationPOPNETSSH is a novel digital infrastructure and research community with the aim of unlocking longitudinal social network data on the entire population of the Netherlands for academic research purposes A firstofakind research infrastructure tailored in terms of hard and software specifically for largescale social network analysis will be developed The available data includes the complete social network at populationscale of the 17 million inhabitants of Netherlands, including all family, neighborhood, school and work relations, as well as demographic information From this, actionable insights into key issues including segregation, substantive social change, and UN sustainable development goals such as reducing inequality can be obtainedThe project is a collaboration of the University of Amsterdam UvA, Leiden University UL and Statistics Netherlands CBS The researcher will work in an interdisciplinary social data science environment, bringing together computer science with the social sciences and humanitiesWe will put together a curriculum which will also include the opportunity to attend training courses and both national and international eventsYou may also be tasked with smaller teaching activitiesThe selected Postdoctoral researcher will be employed at the University of Amsterdams Faculty of Humanities within the Department of Media Studies and will execute the research in the ILLC The employment contract will be for 38 hours per week 1,0 FTE for a maximum of two years The initial employment is for 1 year Following a positive assessment and barring altered circumstances, this term will be extended by 1 year The intended starting date is 1 February 2021 or as soon as possible thereafter The gross monthly salary may range from 3,491 scale 105 to 4,012 scale 112 depending on experience and qualifications, in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities We additionally offer an extensive package of secondary benefits, including 8 holiday allowance and a yearend bonus of 8,3To work at the University of Amsterdam is to work in a discerning, independent, creative, innovative and international climate characterised by an open atmosphere and a genuine engagement with the city of Amsterdam and society38 hours per weekKloveniersburgwal 48

Job Title: postdoc on Standard Model Effective Field Theory interpretation of Higgs experimental data (ATLAS/Theory)
Job Description: Nikhef, the national institute for subatomic physics in The Netherlands, is looking for apostdoc on Standard Model Effective Field Theory interpretation of Higgs experimental data ATLASTheoryThe Nikhef organizationNikhef is the national institute for subatomic physics in The Netherlands At Nikhef, approximately 175 physicists and 75 technical staff members work together in an open and international scientific environment Together, they perform theoretical and experimental research in the fields of particle and astroparticle physics The Nikhef institute is a collaboration between six major Dutch universities and the Dutch Foundation for Scientific Research NWONikhef participates in large research collaborations, including the ATLAS, LHCb and ALICE experiments at CERN, the KM3NeT neutrino telescope in the Mediterranean, the VIRGO interferometer in Pisa, the Xenon1T dark matter experiment in Gran Sasso, the Pierre Auger cosmic ray observatory in Argentina and the eEDM research programme in Groningen Nikhef also hosts a group in theoretical physics, and groups for Physics Data Processing and detector RD, all with good connections to the experimental programsThe Nikhef ATLAS groupThe Nikhef ATLAS group consists of groups in Amsterdam and Nijmegen, for a total of 15 staff, and typically 5 postdocs and 20 PhD students As a founding member of the ATLAS collaboration, the group has a longterm involvement in both detector construction the semiconductor tracker, barrel muon chambers, readout, alignment, and data acquisition as well as operations trigger and muon tracking reconstruction For the phase2 upgrade , we will assemble and commission one of the endcaps of a new allsilicon inner tracking system ITk in Amsterdam and develop a new universal readout system FELIX for all ATLAS detector systems The group also has a strong record in physics data analysis, with strong focus on Higgs boson physics, top quark physics and machinelearning assisted searches for new physics signatures Nikhef also hosts an ATLAS Tier1 data processing center, and offers substantial additional computing resources for enduser data analysis and simulationThe Nikhef Theory groupThe Nikhef Theory is composed by 10 staff members and around 10 postdocs and 15 PhD students The group has a strong expertise in effective field theories, higher order calculations in quantum chromodynamics, machine learning in particle physics, proton structure determinations, flavor and beyond the standard model physics, and cosmology among others The group also has strong connections with other national and international groups in theoretical high energy physics, as well as frequent interactions with the experimental groups at NikhefThe positionThe Nikhef Atlas and Theory groups have a large and active research program on Higgs data analysis, with a recent focus on interpretation of joint datasets in the framework of SM Effective Field Theory The successful candidate will work on effective field theory interpretations of Higgs production measurements at the LHC, both within the ATLAS collaboration and for standalone theoretical and feasibility studies Potential candidates should have a strong interest in collider phenomenology and effective theories The candidate is expected to qualify as author of the ATLAS collaboration, which entails a contribution to the operation of the ATLAS experiment note that being already qualified is not a requirement for the position For candidates with a theoretical background, expertise with modelling tools relevant for EFT interpretations, eg in the domain of MC event generation, is encouragedThis position offered is part of a joint ATLASTheory program that also comprises a PhD position on SMEFT development in the theory group, and comes with substantial dedicated computing resources for data analysis and simulation studies The scientific program of this position also aligns strongly with that of the NWOfunded physics program At the heart of the Higgs , which will comprise an additional 7 PhD positions and 3 postdoc positions in the Nikhef ATLAS group in the periodall focused on Higgs boson physics This program offers networking opportunities and specialized training programs in data analysis techniques and Higgs boson physics that are also available to the candidate

Job Title: Postdoctoral researcher in Computational Social Science
Job Description: Are you a passionate and committed researcher and well versed in cuttingedge computational social science approaches Would you like to be involved in frontier research on largescale network analysis and official register data and work with highly qualified researchers in an interdisciplinary academic environment Effective immediately, we are seeking a postdoc in Computational Social Science You will be part of the POPNET platform, and your position is hosted by the Faculty of Humanities You will do your research under the aegis of the Institute for Logic, Language and Computation ILLC The ILLC is a renowned research institute at the University of Amsterdam, in which researchers from the Faculty of Humanities and the Faculty of Science collaborate As an ideal candidate for this position, you find yourself at home in the international computational social science research community You have a welldeveloped skillset in scientific programming and an affinity with network analysis in particular You are able to work with very large data and have the creativity and curiosity to develop new network measures and statistics You are keenly aware of the ethical issues related to using large scale social register data and want to contribute to a responsible scholarly practice on big data analytics You may have a disciplinary background in either social sciences, humanities or computational sciences, but you strongly believe in interdisciplinary collaboration You are a creative team player who does not shy back from entering new scholarly terrain You have creativity, precision, and perseverance You do not believe universities should be ivory towers but rather sites for independent thought and academic progress, working together with stakeholders inside and outside academia You take initiative, have excellent communication skills, and you are well able to work in a team as well as independently You like to collaborate both with academics and nonexperts and you can present complex statistical models to both groups in a bespoke manner You care more about social impact of your work than impact factors, but because you are ambitious you always aim for the top Do you recognize yourself Do you want to be involved in frontier computational social science research Are you thrilled by the opportunity to work in a truly interdisciplinary research environment Send us your application Project and job description POPNETSSH is a novel digital infrastructure and research community with the aim of unlocking longitudinal social network data on the entire population of the Netherlands for academic research purposes A firstofakind research infrastructure tailored in terms of hard and software specifically for largescale social network analysis will be developed The available data includes the complete social network at populationscale of the 17 million inhabitants of Netherlands, including all family, neighborhood, school and work relations, as well as demographic information From this, actionable insights into key issues including segregation, substantive social change, and UN sustainable development goals such as reducing inequality can be obtained The project is a collaboration of the University of Amsterdam UvA, Leiden University UL and Statistics Netherlands CBS The researcher will work in an interdisciplinary social data science environment, bringing together computer science with the social sciences and humanities What will you be doing as a PostdocWhat do we require of youOur offer The selected Postdoctoral researcher will be employed at the University of Amsterdams Faculty of Humanities within the Department of Media Studies and will execute the research in the ILLC The employment contract will be for 38 hours per week 1,0 FTE for a maximum of two years The initial employment is for 1 year Following a positive assessment and barring altered circumstances, this term will be extended by 1 year The intended starting date is 1 February 2021 or as soon as possible thereafter The gross monthly salary may range from 3,491 scale 105 to 4,012 scale 112 depending on experience and qualifications, in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement of Dutch Universities We additionally offer an extensive package of secondary benefits, including 8 holiday allowance and a yearend bonus of 8,3 What else can we offer you To work at the University of Amsterdam is to work in a discerning, independent, creative, innovative and international climate characterised by an open atmosphere and a genuine engagement with the city of Amsterdam and society Job application The UvA is an equal opportunity employer We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees We value a spirit of enquiry and endurance, provide the space to keep asking questions and cherish a diverse atmosphere of curiosity and creativity We especially welcome applications from members of underrepresented groups Does this profile sound like you

Job Title: Vacature Monteur/ technisch schoonmaker fulltime Bergschenhoek - Bergschenhoek
Job Description: Een grote internationale opdrachtgever van ons is op zoek naar monteurs Zij zoeken gedreven en gemotiveerde medewerkers die graag aan de slag willen als onderhoudsmonteur binnen de utiliteitsbouw, brand en de scheepvaart Als onderhoudsmonteur hou je je oa bezig met het reinigen, desinfecteren, inspecteren, ontroesten en coaten van luchtkanalen Hierbij zal er droge perslucht door de luchtkanalen gepompt worden om de luchtkwaliteit te verbeteren Ontroesten Reinigen Desinfecteren en inspecteren Coaten Schade behandelingJe kan ingezet worden voor verschillende projecten Zo kan er een grote brand zijn geweest in een discotheek wat weer gangbaar gemaakt moet worden of zal je ventilatiekasten op een dak van een groot gebouw moet behandelen, maar ook ventilatiekanalen in een zwembad moeten zo nu en dan gereinigd worden Een diverse functie met veel afwisseling in teamverband dusNa 4 weken meelopen met een ervaren monteur zal je meer werkzaamheden erbij krijgen Uiteraard ligt jouw takenpakket geheel aan de ervaring die je al heb en hoe snel je alles oppakt Op den duur bestaat ook de kans op een eigen werkbus en zal jij dus mensen moeten inwerken en aansturen Vervolgens kom je na 6 maanden in aanmerking om mee te kunnen op klussen in het buitenland Hierbij moet je denken aan landen zoals oa Dubai, Singapore, Polen en Suriname Uiteraard is hierbij het kan zijn Ook hiervoor is alles financieel geregeld en ontvang je een extra vergoedingTechnische achtergrond enof affiniteit met techniek Enthousiast en gemotiveerd Representatief en klantvriendelijk Who We Are And What We DoASC is a world leading provider of onpremise and cloudbased products for authoring technical publications, elearning and pharmaceutical informationWhat does that mean for our customers Our two software platforms, Docuvera and Authorit, enable the transformation of how our customers create and manage their content, leveraging a component first approach where content is broken down, easily assembled into documents and reused across their organisation Our two products serve different industries Authorit focuses on elearning and technical publications, while Docuvera focuses on life sciences and we seek to solve one of Biopharmas major challenges the inefficiency of managing information across the drug development lifecycleOur global ASC team are a diverse, committed group of experts who are progressive in their approach and know what makes a great product Our Technology, Product, Sales and Corporate Services teams are based throughout New Zealand,
